item.title: Loose and noisy manhole cover on Station road, outside 1 Barnhay perimeter wall. Junction of Station Road/Pirton Lane (Churchdown), 3rd August
item.description:
Junction of Station Road/Pirton Lane (Churchdown). Although this has been reported before (over 1 year ago) and an attempted repair to the tarmac was made, it didn't cure the issue. Since the gas pipe upgrade, the noise from this item has increased to disturbing levels. The problem is the manhole cover itself is not sitting correctly in its frame. It is a diagonal split cover design, which can heard even when standing on it! When cars go over it, the noise is incredibly loud.The whole unit needs replacing! This is disturbing our family and visitors' sleep and enjoyment of the garden. The noise level and frequency of it is increasing daily and is affecting my personal mental health.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road drain becoming damaged/blocked by vegetation., 3rd August
item.description:
Location: Road drain outside No. 14 Delphinium Drive, Bishops Cleeve, GL52 8HQ (at driveway South side). Issue: Becoming damaged and blocked by vegetation. The interior brickwork may be distorting/bulging too. Main drain for this area of the road (ie. the roundabout). How long: Originally reported ~6 years ago, but not cleared, and so has grown steadily worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Delphinium Drive, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Holes in grass, 3rd August
item.description:
Houses near crossing are driving on the pavement and grass causing deep holes that may unearth utility systems. A child on a bike was almost hit whilst cycling in the pavement the other day by the driver in house with white render and gravel on front. They had to emergency stop. You should put up some bollards to prevent pavements being driven on for health and safety of children crossing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Bramble Chase, Tewkesbury

item.title: Pot hole emerging from existing repair in path of car tyre, 2nd August
item.description:
There are a series of potholes that are gradually increasing in size as they are previous repairs that have begun to fail. They are in the direct path of car tyres and due to one in particular being on the entrance to a roundabout with no options to avoid without hitting the raised paving on either side of the roundabout entrance. This is entering the roundabout heading towards Asda. These are likely to just get worse as colder and wetter weather starts. As a cyclist I have to ride in the middle of the road to avoid these holes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged pavement, 2nd August
item.description:
This is the 5th time the bin lorry has damaged the pavement outside my house. Each time I recommend a more thorough fix is done to prevent this but each time it is just refilled and the same keeps happening. So much time and money has been wasted just doing the same thing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millham Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
